text: Edmond Henri Fischer (April 6, 1920 - August 27, 2021) was a Swiss-born American biochemist. He and his partner Edwin G. Krebs were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1992 for their works on phosphorylation works as a switch to activate proteins and regulate various cellular processes. From 2007 until 2014, he was the Honorary President of the World Cultural Council. Fischer died on August 27, 2021 in Seattle, Washington at the age of 101. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Swiss biologists Category:American biochemists Category:Scientists from Shanghai Category:American centenarians
title: Edmond H. Fischer
